noun.description: A pattern of spirals or concentric circles.
examples: Shelley drew larger and larger dark whorls on her notepad

noun.description: A small wheel or pulley in a spinning wheel, spinning machine, or spindle.

verb.description: Spiral or move in a twisted and convoluted fashion.
examples: the dances are kinetic kaleidoscopes where steps whorl into wildness

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a small flywheel): apparently a variant of whirl, influenced by Old English wharve whorl of a spindle.
